subject: Travel
title: The Amazon's Garden Cities
description: One-minute skill: The Amazon's Garden Cities.

hook.text: The Amazon was thought to be untouched wilderness. Satellites revealed massive ancient cities hidden beneath it.

buildup.text: Spanish explorers in the 1540s reported large cities along the Amazon. Later visitors found only jungle.

discovery.text: Deforestation and LiDAR exposed geometric earthworks, roads, and plazas supporting millions of people.

twist.text: European diseases arrived before European explorers. Populations collapsed before anyone could document them.

climax.text: The 'pristine' Amazon was actually a managed landscape. Its dark, fertile soil was engineered by its inhabitants.

punchline.text: The jungle wasn't wild. Humans designed it thousands of years ago.

quiz.question: Why were Amazon cities never documented by later European visitors?
options: Disease wiped out populations before explorers arrived
